channel.title: Comments on: 4201 S. Crenshaw/3600 W. Stocker
channel.description: Blogging demolitions one building at a time.

item.title: By: Michael
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Hi Nathan, Thank you for this history. I really appreciate the 'Bank' history of Liquor Bank via B of A. I'm doing cyanotypes and handmade negatives of developments in process (via the designers' renderings), and in this case want to do one just of the Liquor Bank's intersection. In any case, thanks again...i'm sure there's plenty of RIP in the Crenshaw/Leimert areas to keep track of...
item.content:encoded:
Hi Nathan,
Thank you for this history. I really appreciate the ‘Bank’ history of Liquor Bank via B of A.
I’m doing cyanotypes and handmade negatives of developments in process (via the designers’ renderings), and in this case want to do one just of the Liquor Bank’s intersection.
In any case, thanks again…i’m sure there’s plenty of RIP in the Crenshaw/Leimert areas to keep track of…

item.title: By: Steven Keylon
item.dc:creator: Steven Keylon
item.description: Thanks, Nathan! I just found this post, looking for something else. Our friends have a Roland Crawford house in Royal Carrizo, above Palm Desert. Tommy Tomson did the landscape for that, and laid out the community. I agree, there should be a book about Late Moderne, it has been my favorite always.
item.content:encoded: Thanks, Nathan! I just found this post, looking for something else. Our friends have a Roland Crawford house in Royal Carrizo, above Palm Desert. Tommy Tomson did the landscape for that, and laid out the community. I agree, there should be a book about Late Moderne, it has been my favorite always.
